Text: (I'm not the picky type.)
(I don't care too much when it comes to most things.)
(But there are times when even I get finicky.)

(It may not be anything important, but I like what I
like and dislike what I dislike.)
(These interests are trivial...)
(whether I enjoy them or not.)
(This is one of those guilty pleasures.)
(Hot springs.)
Phew...
Hmhmm, hmm-hmm
*gasp*
Hmhmm, hmm-hmm
Wha...!
Hmhmm, hmm-hmm

(There was a period in my past life where I didn't
bathe at all. Time spent soaking was time wasted
in my eyes.)

(I still had to keep up appearances as an extra
though, so I did spend three minutes in the
shower every day.)

(But time in the tub was time that could be better
spent on training.)

(That was right around when I came up against the
limits of the human species. To put it simply, I was
losing my mind.)

(Like, I'm talking seriously considering ways I could
repel a nuke with a right straight.)

(Anyway, a bunch of stuff happened, and I realized
how out of whack I was, so I got back in the habit of
bathing.)

(It was a hot spring that got me back on track.
Soaking in hot water fosters composure in the
soul.)

(Which ties directly to the quality of my training
and fostered the idea of magic and auras.)

(Lindwurm here is famous for its hot springs, so I've
secretly been super-excited about it.)

(It's early in the morningâ€”my favorite time to hit
the springs. That doesn't mean I wouldn't go at
night, but mornings are best.)

(There are usually fewer people around. Sometimes, I
even get the whole place to myself.)

(I came today hoping to get that private time, but it
seems someone had the same idea and beat me to it.)

(And to make it worse, that someone is none other
than Alexia.)

Alexia has her long white hair bundled up, her red
eyes going wide as they momentarily lock with mine.
We both quickly look away.

We choose a policy of mutual nonintervention and act
as if the other isn't there.

This spring is reserved for nobility, so there are
few guests in the early morning hours. And so
the usual dividers are removed, opening it up
for mixed bathing.

It is a spacious bath, steam covering everything
below eye level. The sun starts to rise.

I bask in the sunrise and water, thinking how awesome
it would've been to have this all to myself.

Alexia and I sit on opposite ends of the open-air
bath with the ultimate view, watching the sun rise in
uncomfortable silence.

In the corner of my eye, I see Alexia's pale skin
shift, creating ripples in the water.

As I am making the reluctant decision to get
out early, she breaks the silence.
*sigh*
How are your wounds?
All healed up.
I wonder which wounds she's referring to as I answer.
I see.

I got carried away when I sliced you up. I'm glad
you survived.
...High praise from a murderous slasher, I suppose.
Did you say something?
Nope. Not a thing.

(I've known Alexia long enough to tell that this
is her attempt at an apology.)

(I'd originally doubted if she had anyone teach her
what an apology actually was,)
(but I guess this is her version of one.)
So what brings you to Lindwurm?
I'm here for the Goddess' Trial. You?

A friend invited me since there's gonna be some sort
of event happening.

I think they meant the Goddess' Trial...but what
is it, exactly?
I can hear Alexia sigh.
Hmph, so you came here without knowing a thing, huh?

The Goddess' Trial is a battle held once a year when
they open the door to the Sanctuary.
A battle...?

Memories of ancient warriors are awoken from within,
and challengers come to fight them.
So...theyâ€™re fighting ghosts?
(That must be what Alpha meant... It does sound fun.)

If you're thinking of trying it out, you're probably
too late. You have to submit an application beforehand.

The ancient warriors will only answer the calls of
worthy opponents. Usually, the warrior is a
little stronger than the challenger.

Several hundred contestants enter each year, but only
ten or so actually end up getting to fight.

A few years ago, everyone was talking about when
Venom the Wandering Swordsman called forth the
hero Olivier.
Did he win?
Apparently not.

I didn't actually see the battle though, so I'm not
sure exactly what happenedâ€¦

There's also the possibility that the warrior he
summoned may not have really been Olivier.
Hmm...

(I wonder if Alpha could summon up a hero of legend.
It'd be a blast if she did.)
I won't be participating.
I have more pressing matters to attend to.
Huh.

The news hasn't been made public yet, but the
archbishop of the Cathedral was murdered.
Huh.

Unsavory rumors about the archbishop have been
circling for a while, so I'm joining the investigation.

Oh, but I can't tell you anything else because you're
not involved.
If you want to know more, join the Crimson Order.
No thanks.
Then after you graduate.
No thanks.
I'll submit an application for you.
Please don't.
You're so stubborn.

The conversation breaks off there, and we spend more
time together in silence.
The atmosphere isn't so awkward this time.

Alexia moves out of my periphery. Her long legs float
on the surface, causing a succession of ripples.
I'd expected more ogling, but I guess I was wrong.

Alexia didn't specify what she thought I'd be looking
at.
Someone's confident.

When you're a perfect beauty like me, it's annoying
to constantly put up with lusty gazes.
(Yet here you are wearing nothing.)
I try not to look at others when in a hot spring.
That way, we can all use them in peace.

So on that note...how about you stop stealing peeks
at my Excalibur?
Heh, THAT is "Excalibur"?

Alexia laughs like she is mocking me
wholeheartedly.
You sure you didn't mean "Earthworm"?

I stand up with a big splash, sending ripples
everywhere.
You shouldn't judge everything on appearances...
*gasp*

Maybe this "earthworm" just hasn't left its scabbard
yet.

I turn around and leave the bath with my goods all on
full display.
What...does that even mean...?

When the holy sword is drawn from its scabbard, its
ivory blade will be unleashed, sending you on a
journey to the Garden of Chaos...

With that suggestive-sounding statement, I snap my
wet towel up between my legs to clap loudly against
my butt.

(I always liked how old guys do that when they get
out of the bath.)

(There's no particular reason why, but the experience
isn't complete unless I do it too.)

After a second and third time, I head to the dressing
room.

Just as I finish putting my clothes on, I hear the
sound of snapping coming from the bath.

Time passes and the day of the Goddess' Trial
finally arrives.
